author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
Triple-A-Plus
Apple, Amazon and Alphabet boasted soaring revenues and record quarterly financials, even as the tech giants face growing scrutiny over their influence on society and their dominance of certain markets. Apple’s gamble on a $1,000 iPhone, for which demand appears to be soft, seems to be having limited impact: Revenue rose 13% to a record $88.29 billion in the three months through December. But the company projected weaker-than-expected revenue for the current quarter—with iPhone sales falling 1% to...
